hero.title: Give your customers an online store they love – keep the Quick3 you trust
hero.subtitle: Install the WordPress plugin that connects WooCommerce and Quick3 automatically. Increase sales and conversions with seamless ERP integration.
hero.description: Combine the strengths: Let Quick3 handle accounting, inventory, and logistics. Let WooCommerce drive sales with professional design, modern checkout, and seamless user experience.

features.heading: Automate everything
features.title: Everything you need for seamless synchronization
features.description: Quick3 for WooCommerce makes it easy to keep products and inventory synchronized between Quick3 ERP and WooCommerce. Robust background processing handles large catalogs without issues.

productSync.name: Automatic product synchronization
productSync.description: Import and update products from Quick3 to WooCommerce automatically. Product information, images, prices, and variants are always kept up to date – without manual work.

orderSync.name: Real-time order synchronization
orderSync.description: Orders from WooCommerce are instantly transferred to Quick3 with complete customer data and payment information. No delays, no manual intervention.

multiWarehouse.name: Multi-warehouse management
multiWarehouse.description: Keep inventory updated across all locations. Customers can see availability per warehouse directly in the online store – perfect for physical stores with multiple locations.

smartPricing.name: Intelligent pricing
smartPricing.description: Advanced pricing system with support for regular price, sale prices and time-based campaigns. Everything synchronizes automatically.

backgroundProcessing.name: Reliable background processing
backgroundProcessing.description: Robust job system handles large catalogs without problems. Processes run in the background without affecting store performance, with automatic error handling and self-healing functions.

wordpressNative.name: WordPress-native plugin
wordpressNative.description: Built with WordPress and WooCommerce standards. Follows best practices for performance, security, and maintenance. Full support for WooCommerce hooks and filters for developers.

items.question: Can I get help setting up the plugin?
items.answer: Yes! Our partners can help you with professional setup and support.

items.question: What is Quick3 for WooCommerce?
items.answer: Quick3 for WooCommerce is a WordPress plugin that automatically synchronizes products, prices, inventory, orders, and customers between Quick3 ERP and your WooCommerce store. Everything runs in the background, keeping your online store updated with the Quick3 system without manual intervention.

items.question: What are the system requirements?
items.answer: The plugin requires: WordPress 6.0 or newer, WooCommerce 7.0 or newer, PHP 8.1 or newer, WP-CLI installed on the server, and a valid Quick3 API token. We strongly recommend a VPS with multiple CPU cores rather than standard web hosting, as synchronization requires processing power for data transformation and product matching.

items.question: How do I get a Quick3 API token?
items.answer: You can get the API token from your Quick3 account. Once you have it, add it to your WordPress configuration by defining QUICK3_TOKEN in your wp-config.php file: define('QUICK3_TOKEN', 'your-api-token-here'); Read the "Get Started" guide for more information about this process. The plugin displays configuration status on the Quick3 Settings page.

items.question: How often is data synchronized between Quick3 and WooCommerce?
items.answer: Synchronization frequency depends on your subscription: Free (manual synchronization only), Business (every 30 minutes), Enterprise (every 15 minutes). You can configure this under WP Admin > Quick3 Settings > Synchronization Settings.

items.question: What data is synchronized?
items.answer: The plugin synchronizes: products and product variants, product names, descriptions and attributes, regular prices and sale prices (including time-based campaigns), stock levels and stock status, product images, orders (from WooCommerce to Quick3), and customer information.

items.question: What are the product limits for each plan?
items.answer: Free: Up to 50 products, Business: Up to 10,000 products, Enterprise: Unlimited products. The plugin displays your current usage and limits on the Quick3 Settings page with a visual progress bar.

items.question: Does the plugin work with Quick3's API limitations?
items.answer: Yes, the plugin is designed to work within Quick3's strict API limitations. Instead of making separate API calls for each inventory update, the plugin fetches all products periodically (based on your subscription). This stays well within API limits while keeping your inventory synchronized.

items.question: What happens to my existing WooCommerce products?
items.answer: The plugin does not delete existing WooCommerce products. It creates a link between Quick3 products and WooCommerce products using SKU and metadata. If a product exists, it is updated. If no match is found, a new product is created. Existing products not from Quick3 remain untouched.

items.question: How do I troubleshoot if products are not synchronizing?
items.answer: Check these common issues first: Verify that the Quick3 API token is correctly configured in Quick3 Settings, check that WordPress cron is working properly, view job status under WP Admin > Jobs to check if any jobs failed, check job logs for specific error messages, and ensure you haven't reached the product limit for your subscription.

items.question: Can I trigger a synchronization manually instead of waiting for automatic sync?
items.answer: Yes! You can trigger a product synchronization manually at any time from WP Admin > Quick3 for WooCommerce > Jobs. Click "New job" and select the job you want to run. This is useful for testing the connection or immediately updating after changes in Quick3. Quick3's API limitations still apply, but the plugin has built-in protection that prevents you from exceeding these limits.

getStarted.title: Get started in under 10 minutes
getStarted.intro: Follow this simple guide to connect Quick3 ERP to WooCommerce. With 7 easy steps, you'll have automatic synchronization of products, prices, orders, and inventory.

downloadSection.title: Download plugin
downloadSection.description: Get started for free by downloading the Quick3 for WooCommerce plugin. No credit card required.

step1.title: 1. Install the plugin
step1.description: Find and install Quick3 for WooCommerce from the WordPress plugin directory. The process takes just a few minutes and requires no technical expertise.
steps: Log in to WordPress and go to the admin panel where you manage your site.
Plugins → Add New to find and install new WordPress plugins.
Search for "Quick3 for WooCommerce" in the plugin directory and click Install Now.
Activate the plugin after installation to get started.
step1.warning: Important: Make sure WooCommerce is already installed and activated before installing Quick3 for WooCommerce.

step2.title: 2. Activate license
step2.description: Activate or purchase a Freemius license to access all features. The plugin offers both free and paid options depending on your needs.
steps: Follow the Freemius instructions displayed after activating the plugin.
Choose license type – free for testing or paid for production with priority support.
Business use? Paid license is recommended for production environments with dedicated support.

step3.title: 3. Get Quick3 API token
step3.description: To connect to Quick3 ERP, you need an API token. This is generated directly from your Quick3 account and gives the plugin secure access to product data.
steps: Log in to Quick3 with your company account.
Go to Home → Client Settings → Security to manage API access.
Generate new token and select ApiV2 as the API type. Remember to mark it as active.
Copy the API key and have it ready for the next step.
step3.warning: If you don't have access to API settings, contact Quick3 support to activate API access on your account. We use V2 API (BETA).

step4.title: 4. Configure Quick3 connection
step4.description: The API key should be added to the wp-config.php file as this is more secure than adding it via the admin panel.

substep1.title: Step 1: wp-config.php
substep1.description: Edit wp-config.php and add the following lines above /* That's all, stop editing! */:

substep2.title: Step 2: Via admin panel
steps: Go to Quick3 for WooCommerce → Settings in the WordPress menu.
Fill in Base URL: You can find this in Quick3 by looking at the URL. You enter something similar to this: https://q3.quick.no/ProdShared021
Save and test the connection to verify that everything works.

step5.title: 5. Configure order settings
step5.description: Link WooCommerce payment methods to Quick3 payment terms for automatic order synchronization. This ensures that orders are processed correctly in Quick3 based on how the customer pays.
steps: Go to Quick3 for WooCommerce → Settings → Order Settings in the WordPress menu.
Enable Auto-sync orders to Quick3 for automatic order synchronization.
Match payment methods: Match the payment method in WooCommerce with the correct account in Quick3.
Select default account for new products: If there's a product in WooCommerce that doesn't exist in Quick3, you must select a default account that this should be posted to in Quick3.
Save the settings when you're done with the configuration.
step5.note: Payment terms are automatically fetched from Quick3 when the connection is configured, so you always have updated options to choose from.

step6.title: 6. Verify synchronization jobs
step6.description: Now that everything is configured, check that automatic synchronization jobs are running as expected.
steps: Go to Quick3 for WooCommerce → Jobs to see job status.
Look for job runs that start automatically based on the configured interval.
Click on a job to see detailed status and logs in real-time.
Wait for "Completed" status – the first sync can take a few minutes depending on the number of products.

step7.title: 7. Confirm order synchronization
step7.description: The final step is to test that orders are synchronized correctly back to Quick3. This ensures that the entire flow from online store to ERP system works seamlessly.
steps: Go to the WooCommerce store and place a test order.
Complete the payment and make sure the order has reached "processing".
Log in to Quick3 and verify that the order appears there.
Check details – customer, product, and payment information should be correct.
step7.congratulations: Congratulations! Quick3 for WooCommerce is now fully configured and ready to use. You have automatic synchronization of products, prices, inventory, and orders.

readyToGo.title: You're ready to go live!
readyToGo.paragraph1: Quick3 for WooCommerce will now automatically keep products, prices, and inventory synchronized between Quick3 ERP and WooCommerce. Orders are automatically sent to Quick3 when paid, and everything happens in the background without you needing to do anything.
readyToGo.paragraph2: Synchronization runs automatically every 15 minutes (if you have enterprise), which means product data and inventory status are always up to date. You can check job status in the admin panel at any time or adjust settings as needed.

docs.description: Learn more about how synchronization works and explore advanced features

contact.description: Contact us for support, assistance, or questions about the setup

docs.title: Documentation
docs.intro: Complete user guide for Quick3 for WooCommerce. This documentation covers all aspects of the plugin, from technical details to troubleshooting.

overview.title: Overview
overview.intro: Quick3 for WooCommerce is a WordPress plugin that automatically synchronizes product data between the Quick3 ERP system and your WooCommerce store. The plugin handles:
overview.requirementsIntro: To use Quick3 for WooCommerce you need:
overview.performanceNote: Recommended: VPS with multiple CPU cores provides significantly better performance than standard web hosting. Synchronization requires processing power for data transformation and product matching, especially for large product catalogs.

sync.title: How synchronization works
sync.flowIntro: The synchronization process follows these steps:

flowSteps.label: Fetching:
flowSteps.description: Product data is fetched from Quick3 API

flowSteps.label: Transformation:
flowSteps.description: Data is converted to WooCommerce format

flowSteps.label: Matching:
flowSteps.description: Existing products are matched via SKU

flowSteps.label: Updating:
flowSteps.description: Products are created or updated in WooCommerce

flowSteps.label: Images:
flowSteps.description: Product images are downloaded and added to WordPress media library

productInfo.title: Product information
items: Barcode (synced to GTIN field in WooCommerce)

inventory.title: Inventory
items: Stock status (in stock / out of stock)

sync.matchingDescription: To avoid duplicates, Quick3 for WooCommerce matches products based on SKU (Stock Keeping Unit). If a product with the same SKU already exists in WooCommerce, it will be updated instead of creating a new product.
sync.matchingTip: Tip: Keep SKU values consistent between Quick3 and WooCommerce for best results. Avoid manually changing SKUs in WooCommerce.
sync.scheduleIntro: You can configure how often synchronization should run:

scheduleOptions.label: Hourly:
scheduleOptions.description: For stores with infrequent product changes

scheduleOptions.label: Manual:
scheduleOptions.description: Only when you manually start the job

sync.apiLimitNote: Important: Quick3 API has a rate limit of approximately 4 requests per hour for batch operations. The plugin fetches all products every 15 minutes instead of separate stock updates to avoid exceeding this limit.
sync.productConnectionsIntro: Quick3 for WooCommerce automatically synchronizes product relationships from Quick3 to WooCommerce. These relationships help customers discover related products and increase average order value.

upsells.title: Upsell Products (Alternative Products)
upsells.description: Alternative products from Quick3 become upsell suggestions in WooCommerce. These are bidirectional relationships between parent products.
items: Quick3 'Alternative' connection type maps to WooCommerce upsells
Displayed on product pages as "You may also like..."
Bidirectional: If Product A suggests Product B, then Product B suggests Product A
Always links between parent products (not variations)

crossSells.title: Cross-sell Products (Accessory Products)
crossSells.description: Accessory products from Quick3 become cross-sell suggestions in WooCommerce. These are unidirectional relationships.
items: Quick3 'Accessory' connection type maps to WooCommerce cross-sells
Displayed in cart and checkout as complementary products
Unidirectional: Product A can suggest Product B, but not vice versa
Can link to specific product variations or main products

metadata.title: Other Connection Types (Metadata)
metadata.description: Other Quick3 connection types are stored as structured metadata for future use:
items: Contains, Set, TransferredTo, FractionOf, Batch, EntityFee, BatchWithoutHead
Stored in product meta fields: _q3wc_conn_[type] and _q3wc_connections_detail
Available for custom integrations and future features
Preserved with full source system data (priceFactor, quantityFactor, etc.)

automatic.title: Automatic Synchronization
automatic.description: Product connections are automatically synchronized every 15 minutes via a background job. The system intelligently resolves product variations to parent products for upsells, while preserving specific variation links for cross-sells. Only products with changed connections are updated to maintain performance.

viewInWooCommerce.title: Viewing in WooCommerce
steps: Go to Products in WordPress admin
Edit any product that has connections
Scroll to Linked Products section
See upsells in "Upsells" field and cross-sells in "Cross-sells" field
Additional connection types are stored in custom fields (viewable in "Custom Fields" section)

orderSync.title: Order synchronization
orderSync.intro: Quick3 for WooCommerce keeps orders synchronized between WooCommerce and Quick3 throughout the entire order lifecycle, from placement to completion, returns and cancellations.

newOrders.title: New orders
newOrders.description: When a customer completes a payment in WooCommerce, the order is automatically synchronized to Quick3.

items.label: Trigger:
items.description: Payment provider marks the order as paid and sets the order to "Processing" in WooCommerce

items.label: Action:
items.description: A new order is automatically created in Quick3

items.label: Data:
items.description: Customer info, products, prices and payment details are transferred

shipping.title: Shipping updates
shipping.description: Tracking information from Quick3 is automatically synchronized back to WooCommerce when you add shipping in Quick3.

completed.title: Completed orders
completed.description: When you invoice an order in Quick3, the order is automatically marked as completed in WooCommerce.

items.label: Action:
items.description: Order status in WooCommerce is updated to "Completed"

items.label: Customer:
items.description: Customer receives completion confirmation from WooCommerce

returns.title: Returns
returns.description: Returns must be handled from WooCommerce and are then automatically synchronized to Quick3.

items.label: Synchronization:
items.description: The return is created as a new order in Quick3 with negative amounts

returns.tip: Tip: Always start returns from WooCommerce to ensure correct synchronization to Quick3.

cancellation.title: Order cancellation
cancellation.description: Orders that are not invoiced or have associated pick lists can be cancelled directly from WooCommerce.

items.label: Requirement:
items.description: The order must not be invoiced in Quick3

items.label: Action:
items.description: The order is deleted from Quick3

items.label: Refund:
items.description: Associated refund order is also deleted

cancellation.warning: Important: Invoiced orders cannot be cancelled. These must be handled as returns instead.

limitations.title: Limitations
limitations.description: Due to limitations in the Quick3 API, some operations are not supported:

items.label: Order updates:
items.description: Existing orders cannot be modified after creation in Quick3

items.label: Reason codes:
items.description: Quick3 API does not support updating orders via API

items.label: Solution:
items.description: Changes must be made manually in Quick3

limitations.note: Note: If you need to modify an order after it has been created, this must be done directly in Quick3. This is a limitation in the Quick3 API.

jobSystem.title: Job system
jobSystem.intro: Quick3 for WooCommerce uses a robust background job system to handle synchronization.

types.title: Product import
types.description: Fetches all products from Quick3 and updates the WooCommerce catalog. Runs automatically based on configured frequency.

types.title: Order synchronization
types.description: Fetches updated information from Quick3 per order and updates with tracking info. Runs automatically every 15 minutes.

jobSystem.monitoringIntro: You can monitor synchronization jobs in real-time:
monitoringSteps: Go to Quick3 for WooCommerce → Jobs
View status of ongoing and completed jobs
Click on a job to see detailed logs
errorSteps: Job is marked with error status
Error message is logged with details
Plugin automatically retries at next scheduled run
You can manually run the job again from the admin panel
jobSystem.performanceIntro: Quick3 for WooCommerce is optimized for performance:

performanceItems.label: Background processing:
performanceItems.description: Jobs run in the background without affecting frontend

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.intro: Solutions to common problems and questions about Quick3 for WooCommerce.

steps: Double-check that the API token is correctly copied from Quick3
Ensure there are no spaces before or after the token
Verify that the token has not expired
Generate a new token if necessary
Check that the Quick3 Base URL is correct
Verify that your server can reach the Quick3 API (no firewall blocks)
Test the connection from WordPress by running a manual synchronization
Check WordPress debug log for detailed error messages
Go to Quick3 for WooCommerce → Jobs and check job status
Look for error messages in the job log
Verify that automatic synchronization is enabled
Check that WordPress cron is running correctly
Try running a manual synchronization by clicking "New job"
Check if the product is set as active in Quick3
Check if the product is set as web-active in Quick3
Check the job log for warnings about specific products
Verify that products have valid data in Quick3
Check that products have unique SKU values
Look for memory limits (PHP memory_limit) that may stop large imports
Large catalogs (1000+ products) naturally take longer
Increase CPU and RAM on the server
Check that the server has enough memory (at least 256MB PHP memory_limit)
Increase PHP max_execution_time if jobs timeout
Check server resources (CPU, memory, disk I/O). Consider increasing capacity
Consider reducing synchronization frequency
Contact hosting provider if problems persist
Check that products have unique SKU values in both Quick3 and WooCommerce
Do not manually change SKUs in WooCommerce after first import
Delete duplicates manually and run synchronization again
Contact support if the problem continues
Check that WordPress has write permissions to the uploads folder
Verify that image URLs from Quick3 are accessible
Check PHP upload_max_filesize and post_max_size settings
Look in the job log for specific image errors
Check that prices are correct in Quick3
Verify VAT/TAX settings in both Quick3 and WooCommerce
Check currency settings
Run a new synchronization to update prices
Check if the job is actually running (see job log in admin panel)
Wait at least 15 minutes before concluding it has stopped
Contact support if the job is still stuck
Check that WordPress has write permissions to the log folder
Verify that logs have not been automatically deleted
See WordPress debug.log for system errors
Check that WordPress cron is not disabled in wp-config.php
Contact hosting provider to verify that cron is working correctly
Consider setting up system cron instead of WP-Cron
Temporarily disable other plugins to identify conflicts
Cache plugins in particular can interfere with synchronization
Report conflicts to support

debugMode.title: Debug mode
debugMode.description: To get more detailed information about errors, enable WordPress debug mode:
debugMode.logLocation: Logs will be written to wp-content/debug.log.

support.title: Need help?
support.intro: If you still have issues after trying the solutions above, we're here to help. Contact us directly or get started with setup by following our guide.
